timeline_html:
Here’s what I’m seeing: Your shedding began roughly 4 months before this assessment (around May 2025). The key triggers showing up are:

  • Chronic illness flare since Feb 2025 and still ongoing — this keeps hair in a stress cycle until the condition settles.
  • Medication change started Mar 2025 and continued through May; some hair fall from this may still be echoing in your cycle.
  • Major emotional stress also noted, though no dates provided — emotional shocks typically show up 2–3 months later in shedding.

Why these matter: Both chronic illness flares and medication changes disturb the normal growth phase, pushing extra hairs into shedding after a lag of ~2–4 months. Because your illness flare remains active, the shedding "waves" you describe make sense.

Timeline forecast ⏳:
• Most intense shedding likely peaked between May–July 2025.
• Stabilization from the medication change alone would be expected around Sep–Nov 2025, but the ongoing illness flare delays full calming. Stabilization will begin ~4–8 weeks once that flare is under control.
• Regrowth signs (baby hairs around the hairline) typically show 6–8 weeks after stabilization begins 🌱.

Where you are now: You’re in the stabilization phase, with the medication-related fallout winding down but the illness flare still prolonging activity. No baby hairs yet is expected at this stage — once the flare eases, regrowth will follow.

❤️ You’re not alone in this — once the ongoing trigger resolves, your body has a strong track record of bouncing back. I’m not here to diagnose, just to map the story your hair is telling right now.
